snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include a judge dismissing a privacy lawsuit against Delta Air Lines over a smartphone app, a 3-D phone screen that is...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include a judge dismissing a privacy lawsuit against Delta Air Lines over a smartphone app, a 3-D phone screen that is said to be one of a number of devices Amazon is working on, and a company that says it can make a smartphone while treating its employees well.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: 3-D Smartphone and Hacking the Onion
